summaryText: Wow, what an incredibly powerful message from Montell Jordan about developing the heart of a servant! In this transformative sermon, Pastor Montell breaks down what it truly means to build on your salvation by embracing humility and serving others. Drawing from his own life experiences in the music industry, he vulnerably shares how God had to humble him, stripping away fame and fortune to help him understand true significance. Can you imagine a multi-platinum R&B artist changing diapers in children's ministry? That's exactly what Montell and his wife did as part of their journey of humility! The core message is simple yet profound: to be like Jesus, we must become servants who prioritize others over ourselves. Whether it's serving your family, workplace, community, or church, the key is approaching every role with humility. Montell challenges us to look beyond worldly success and instead focus on how we can uplift and support those around us. He reminds us that we didn't pay for ourselves - we belong to God - and our ultimate purpose is to reflect Christ's servant heart in everything we do. The most powerful moment? When he shares that for some people, we might be the only representation of Jesus they ever see. Talk about a challenging and inspiring call to action!
mainPoints: Develop a heart of service in your family
Serve with humility in your workplace
Become a servant leader in your community and church

versesMentioned.text: Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus. All of us, then, who are mature should take such a view of things. And if on some point you think differently, that too God will make clear to you. Only let us live up to what we have already attained.

Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.

In your relationships with one another, have the same mindset as Christ Jesus: Who, being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; rather, he made himself nothing by taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness. And being found in appearance as a man, he humbled himself by becoming obedient to death—even death on a cross! Therefore God exalted him to the highest place and gave him the name that is above every name, that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth, and every tongue acknowledge that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
The greatest among you will be your servant.

He must manage his own family well and see that his children obey him, and he must do so in a manner worthy of full respect. (If anyone does not know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God's church?)

Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters, since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. It is the Lord Christ you are serving.

Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Philippians 2:3-4: 'Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.'
Monday.action: Make a list of three people in your life you can intentionally serve today. This could be a coworker, family member, or friend. Perform a specific act of service for each person without expecting anything in return.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see opportunities to serve others today. Give me a humble heart that seeks to lift others up before myself. Show me how I can be your hands and feet in practical ways. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Mark 10:45: 'For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.'
Tuesday.action: At your workplace or in your daily routine, look for a task that nobody wants to do. Volunteer to complete it with a positive attitude, seeing it as an opportunity to serve rather than a burden.
Tuesday.prayer: Jesus, teach me to serve like You served. Help me find joy in humble tasks and see them as opportunities to reflect Your love. Give me the strength to serve without seeking recognition. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Galatians 5:13: 'You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love.'
Wednesday.action: Reach out to someone in your community who might be struggling or lonely. This could be an elderly neighbor, a single parent, or someone going through a difficult time. Offer practical help or simply spend time listening.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, open my eyes to the needs around me. Give me a heart of compassion and the courage to serve others with genuine love. Help me to see people the way You see them. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:10: 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God's grace in its various forms.'
Thursday.focus: Discovering and using your spiritual gifts
Thursday.action: Take time to reflect on your unique talents and abilities. Research ways you could serve in your church or community that align with these gifts. Make a concrete plan to get involved.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal the gifts You've placed in me. Show me how I can use these talents to serve Your kingdom and bless others. Give me courage to step out of my comfort zone. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Matthew 20:26: 'Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant.'
Friday.action: Practice humility by allowing someone else to take credit or lead a project. Look for opportunities to support others' success without seeking recognition for yourself.
Friday.prayer: God, help me to find true greatness in serving others. Remove my pride and teach me the beauty of humility. Let me decrease so that You may increase in my life. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: John 13:14-15: 'Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another's feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.'
Saturday.action: Perform an unexpected, sacrificial act of service for someone in your life. This should be something that requires genuine effort and puts their needs completely ahead of your own.
Saturday.prayer: Jesus, teach me to serve like You served. Help me love others with the same selfless love You demonstrated. Break down my pride and make me a true servant leader. Amen.
